intro: Thesium aspermontanum, commonly known as the rough thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its compact, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically linear and covered with a rough, textured surface, contributing to its common name. Thesium aspermontanum is often found in sandy or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid regions.
